roleset.name: send a package
roleset.note: SHIP-V NOTES: Based on WSJ. Member of VN class send-11.1-1. (from ship.01-v)
SHIPPING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on ship-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls send-11.1-1. (from shipping.01-n)

example.name: nice easy transitive
example.text: World sugar futures prices soared on rumors that Brazil, a major grower and exporter, might not ship sugar this crop year and next.
example.arg: Brazil, a major grower and exporter,

example.name: with destination
example.text: Although much of this country's export corn goes to New Orleans by barge, it is possible for exporters-1 to sidestep the Mississippi River by *trace*-1 shipping a larger-than-normal amount of corn by train to the port.

example.name: with source
example.text: Their museum had purchased an Attic black-figured column krater and shipped it from London.

example.name: oddly intransitive
example.text: I-1'm going *trace*-1 to ship and hope I get paid.

example.name: passive
example.text: Profit per [ton of steel]-1 shipped *trace*-1 dropped to about $33 a ton from $42 a ton last year and $53 a ton in the second quarter, analysts said.

example.name: ergative!
example.text: The first models will ship in the spring, with the largest following in the fall.
example.arg: with the largest following in the fall

example.name: args 0, 1 and 3
example.text: The goal of the RFID was to lower costs in their shipping of products from suppliers

example.name: args 0, 1 and 2
example.text: They do not advertise these numbers profusely since most of the figures are connected with their shipping of jobs to foreign countries, ...

example.name: bummer
example.text: John ships out to Afghanistan next week.
